instruction: Run a basic WebQL extraction command

Execute query with detailed logging for troubleshooting
Execute extraction on a server without display
Save debug logs to a specific file

instruction: Run WebQL with YAML query format
input: Execute a YAML query file
Save results with timestamp in filename
Show all installed WebQL plugins
Show details about a specific plugin
Activate a disabled plugin
Deactivate a running plugin
Install a plugin from PyPI
Execute query and specify input format
Schedule daily extraction at 2 AM
Run all queries in a directory
output:
for query in queries/*.json5; do
  output="results/$(basename "$query" .json5)_$(date +%Y%m%d).json"
  drweb -q "$query" -o "$output" --xvfb -l info
done

input: Execute query with custom timeout
Execute with proper error handling and logging
output: drweb -q query.json5 -o results.json -l debug || echo "Extraction failed" | tee -a error.log

instruction: Optimize WebQL for large-scale data extraction
input: Extract data efficiently from thousands of pages
Reduce memory usage during extraction
Minimize extraction time
Write efficient XPath expressions
output:
# Efficient XPath patterns:

# Use specific selectors:
"//div[@class='product'][1]"  # Better than "//div[1]"

# Use position filters:
"//div[@class='item'][position() <= 50]"  # Limit results

# Use direct attribute access:
"./@data-id"  # Better than ".//text()" when possible

# Combine conditions efficiently:
"//span[@class='price' and not(@class='hidden')]/text()"

input: Reduce browser memory and CPU usage
Run multiple extractions in parallel
output:
# Use multiple WebQL instances:
drweb -q query1.json5 -o results1.json &
drweb -q query2.json5 -o results2.json &
drweb -q query3.json5 -o results3.json &
wait  # Wait for all to complete

# Or use GNU parallel:
parallel -j 4 drweb -q {} -o results_{/.}.json ::: queries/*.json5

input: Reduce network overhead
Extract efficiently from mobile-optimized sites
Efficiently extract structured data
Continue extraction despite individual page failures
Store extracted data efficiently
Set up monitoring for extraction jobs
output:
# Monitor extraction with logging:
drweb -q query.json5 -o results.json -l info --log-file monitoring.log

# Check for errors:
grep -i error monitoring.log && echo "Extraction had errors" | mail -s "WebQL Alert" admin@company.com

# Monitor file size:
if [ $(stat -c%s results.json) -lt 1000 ]; then
  echo "Results file too small, possible extraction failure" | mail -s "WebQL Alert" admin@company.com
fi

input: Choose the most efficient selectors
output:
# Performance ranking (fastest to slowest):

# 1. Direct attribute access (fastest):
"./@id"
"./@data-price"

# 2. Simple element selection:
".//span"
".//div"

# 3. Class-based selection:
".//span[@class='price']"

# 4. Text content extraction:
".//span/text()"

# 5. Complex XPath (slowest):
".//div[contains(@class, 'price') and position() > 1]/text()"

input: Configure WebQL for automated deployment
output:
# Dockerfile optimization:
FROM python:3.11-slim
RUN pip install dr-web-engine && playwright install chromium
COPY queries/ /app/queries/
WORKDIR /app
CMD ["drweb", "-q", "queries/main.json5", "-o", "results.json", "--xvfb"]

# CI/CD script:
#!/bin/bash
set -e
docker build -t webql-extractor .
docker run -v $(pwd)/output:/app/output webql-extractor
aws s3 cp output/results.json s3://data-bucket/$(date +%Y/%m/%d)/

instruction: Use AI selector plugin for natural language element selection
input: Select elements using natural language description

instruction: Configure AI selector plugin with OpenAI
input: Set up AI selector to use OpenAI GPT models
output:
# Export environment variables:
export AI_SELECTOR_API_KEY="sk-your-openai-key"
export AI_SELECTOR_MODEL="gpt-4o-mini"
export AI_SELECTOR_ENDPOINT="https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions"

# Then run your query:
drweb -q ai_query.json5 -o results.json

instruction: Configure AI selector plugin with local Ollama
input: Set up AI selector to use local Ollama models
output:
# Export environment variables:
export AI_SELECTOR_ENDPOINT="http://localhost:11434/api/chat"
export AI_SELECTOR_MODEL="llama3.2:3b"

# Make sure Ollama is running:
ollama serve

# Then run your query:
drweb -q ai_query.json5 -o results.json

instruction: Use output format plugin for LLM training

instruction: Use smart retry plugin for robust extraction
input: Configure intelligent retry logic with exponential backoff
Configure proxy rotation for large-scale extraction
Verify if a plugin is compatible with current DR Web Engine version
Combine AI selector with JSON-LD extraction
Configure plugin with custom settings
output:
# Create plugin config file:
# ~/.drweb/plugins.yaml
ai-selector:
  enabled: true
  config:
    model: "gpt-4o-mini"
    max_tokens: 1000
    temperature: 0.1

jsonld-extractor:
  enabled: true
  config:
    validate_schema: true
    include_context: false

api-extractor:
  enabled: false

input: Validate extracted data using plugin
Troubleshoot plugin problems
output:
# Enable debug logging for plugins:
drweb -q query.json5 -o results.json -l debug

# Check plugin status:
drweb plugin list

# Get detailed plugin info:
drweb plugin info problematic-plugin

# Check plugin logs:
tail -f ~/.drweb/logs/plugin-debug.log
